context.removeLink: Remove link to this Journal Entry.

default.title: Default Description
default.content: Template to be edited preferably in HTML mode.

level1.title: Title 1:
level1.description: Description can be displayed on multiple lines if it's too long.

level2.title: Title 2:
level2.description: You can add as many levels as you want.

level3.title: Title 3:
level3.description: And also use the bullets you prefer.

level4.title: Title 4:
level4.description: You just have to comply to the HTML template,

level5.title: Title 5:
level5.description: or get rid of it and write whatever you want^^.

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.content:
Outside special circumstances, attribute values for most people are between 1 and 3.

Human maximum is set to 5.

level0.title: Terrible:
level0.description: You're certainly afflicted with a severe handicap.

level1.title: Weak:
level1.description: You're very bad at it, maybe you shouldn't even try.

level2.title: Average:
level2.description: Being average is awsome, it means there are people worse than you are.

level3.title: Good:
level3.description: You can easily 'show-off' in bars and parties.

level4.title: Outstanding:
level4.description: Movie and literature heroes got nothing on you.

level5.title: Extra-ordinary:
level5.description: If nobody recognizes you walking down the street, it's because you want it that way.

attributes.footer: Generic description: Please refer to the aforementioned page / rulebook.

spheres.title: Spheres
spheres.content:
Even though Spheres have several points in common in their mastery levels (most notably pattern ones), it'd be impossible to sum it all up in a generic fashion.

Either refer to the core rulebook page 512 or get some compendium module with more accurate descriptions
spheres.footer: Generic description: Please refer to the aforementioned page / rulebook.

talent.title: Talents
talent.content:
Talents have an element of natural predisposition, often also enhanced by experience and or training.

üõà 'Untrained' Talent rolls usually do not have a Difficulty penalty.

level0.title: Lame:
level0.description: At this point, you can only hope for some 'beginners luck'.

level1.title: Mediocre:
level1.description: There are some 10 yo kids out there innately more gifted than you are.

level2.title: Decent:
level2.description: You either have a pretty good idea what you're doing, or it's just raw talent, in which case it's a shame you're not building up on it.

level3.title: Gifted:
level3.description: Among 'regular people' you're already regarded as an exception, what you're capable of would amaze most anyone.

level4.title: Talented:
level4.description: Experience alone cannot explain everything, you definitely possess some tremendous innate talent.

level5.title: Prodigious:
level5.description: You are one of those geniuses who have an instinctive understanding of their art, but above all, who have actively developed it!

talent.footer: Generic description: Please refer to the aforementioned page / rulebook.

skill.title: Skills
skill.content:
Skills are the result of rigorous training, diligent practice, and the application of proven techniques.

üõà 'Untrained' Skill rolls usually have Difficulty malus of 1.

level0.title: Incompetent:
level0.description: Were you to have the slightest idea of what to do, that you still wouldn't have a clue how to proceed anyway.

level1.title: Novice:
level1.description: You have the fundamentals of the field and can therefore vaguely cope with it.

level2.title: Amateur:
level2.description: You are quite competent in everyday situations.

level3.title: Professionnal:
level3.description: With this competence level you could make it your job.

level4.title: Specialist:
level4.description: You are trained for all possible situations, your technical mastery is matched only by your knowledge of the subject.

level5.title: Elite:
level5.description: A few hundred people around the world are capable of such feats. You are one of them.

skill.footer: Generic description: Please refer to the aforementioned page / rulebook.

knowledge.title: Knowledges
knowledge.content:
You either possess the Knowledge, or you don't have it... At all!

üõà 'Untrained' Knowledge rolls are usually unfeasible.

level0.title: Ignorant:
level0.description: If you can't accept your ignorance on the subject, you might as well make up answers.

level1.title: Layman:
level1.description: The worst (or best) part is that you don't even know how uneducated you are on this subject matter.

level2.title: Student:
level2.description: You have some foundation knowledge, it may be incomplete (or even wrong), but at least you are aware of it.

level3.title: Teacher:
level3.description: It's definitely a personal passion of yours. With this amount of culture, you could respectably teach.

level4.title: Doctor:
level4.description: Your research on this topic would be of interest to many; if you have not yet published, perhaps you should.

level5.title: Leading authority:
level5.description: If you're not aware of something regarding this field, it's more than likely no one knows about it either (or it just doesn't exist).

knowledge.footer: Generic description: Please refer to the aforementioned page / rulebook.

hints.canDropJE: Input a value or drag-drop a Journal Entry
hints.createJE: Create a Personnal Journal Entry for this character
hints.date: A more or less precise date?
hints.diceButton: Click to open the Dice Throw Panel (shift+click for a quick-throw)
hints.dicePool: If Dice Pool reaches 0, the throw won't be allowed
hints.displayDescription: Usually displayed in tooltip-text or when 'sending to chat'
hints.itemEffect: Restricted to 1 Active Effect per Item. ‚ö† Editable only when item is not Owned
hints.lexiconPath: A relative path as defined in the localization file
hints.lexiconValue: New translation/paradigm for the above path

magepower.0: üñ±Ô∏è Left : Add Quintessence, üñ±Ô∏è Right : Add Paradox

hints.name: Name of the Trait or Item
hints.openPersonalJE: Open/edit Personnal Journal Entry for this character
hints.systemDescription: Should be edited in HTML mode in order to see the tags
hints.systemName: Used as a reference, only editable by a GM
hints.difficulty: Bonuses and maluses shouldn't exceed -3/+3, otherwise one should adjust the success threshold
hints.unlockToEdit: Switch to 'edition mode'(üîì) in order to edit this field
hints.useAlternateDesc: ‚ö† Will attempt to load alternative trait descriptions suffixed with given tag.

notifications.aEffectOwnedItem:
Foundry doesn't allow for modification of an ActiveEffect on an Owned Item.
In the meantime, you can still drag-drop the item onto the sidebar and edit it from there.
notifications.alreadyAdded: This Trait is already added to the throw!
notifications.cannotThrow0Dice: Impossible Throw: Your Dice pool is empty!
notifications.duplicateName: An item of the same type already exists with same name '{name}' !
notifications.gmPermissionNeeded: You should ask a GM to do that for you!
notifications.insufficentAbilityValue: Your Ability level is too low!
notifications.insufficentSphereValue: Your Sphere level is too low!
notifications.journalLinked: Personnal Journal entry for {name} was created and linked to it's actor.
notifications.missingParadigm: Seems like this actor doesn't have a Paradigm!
notifications.newParadigm: CSS modifications from the paradigm will only be enforced after a refresh (F5).
notifications.notLocalized: Entry '{path}' doesn't exist within the localization file!
notifications.notOutsideCreation: You cannot perfom that action! ( 'Creation Mode' might be locked )
notifications.notTheItemOwner: This throw requires a particular item!
notifications.statLocked: You cannot change Traits for this throw!
notifications.unrollableRote: {actorName} doesn't have the necessary sphere level in order to throw {itemName} !

prompts.actorHasNoOwner:
Actor {name} does not have an Owner!
Do you still wish to create it's Journal?
You'd have to assign permissions yourself later on, for it's owner to have edition privileges.
prompts.addItemWarning:
‚ö† Actual 'names' can be used as references by the system
As a consequence, they will only be modified by a GM.
prompts.deleteContent:
Deletion of '{name}' is final.
Do you wish to proceed ?
prompts.lexiconContentAdd: Adding a new Lexicon entry to this Paradigm.
prompts.lexiconContentEdit: Editing a Lexicon entry for this this Paradigm.
prompts.subTypeContent:
Select a sub type for {type}
This item will be created with default parameters according to the chosen sub type.

versionWarning.warning:
‚ö† This system is still in beta, at your disposal for testing purposes only!

Don't use it if you're not ready to start your world, actors and items from scratch with each update!!!

welcomeMessage.header:
You're seing this message cuz it's the first time you connect to this worlds, so, Welcome !

I hope you'll have a good time using my take on a Mage 20th System.
welcomeMessage.licence: This system agrees and complies to the terms et conditions set by the Dark Pack !
welcomeMessage.noModule: Although the system is meant as a standalone, there might be some non-copyright-infringing modules in your language already, containing Items (abilities, backgrounds, etc...), Journal Entries and maybe more ^^.
welcomeMessage.settings: You can access some usefull system settings here.

SETTINGS.allowAliasesHint: Aliases randomly replace the original character name.
SETTINGS.discordInviteHint: Join the 'Mage-Fr' Discord server (Carter_DC#1097 to hit me).
SETTINGS.displayDifficultyCuesHint: An visual helper to decide on the difficulty for coincidental/vulgar magick indexed on base Diff. and effect max level.
SETTINGS.None: You don't have the necessary permissions to see / modify this sytem's settings.
SETTINGS.openWikiHint: Open the Mage-Fr wiki in an external window.
SETTINGS.playersCanRemoveAggravatedHint: If disabled, players won't be allowed to either add nor remove aggravated-level wounds on their sheet by themselves.
SETTINGS.playersCanSeeParadoxPointsHint: ‚ö† If disabled, players won't see their paradox points but will also be prevented from interracting with the 'Mage Power' UI.
SETTINGS.roteRuleHint: Rolling a 10 grants an extra success when throwing a Rote.
SETTINGS.specialtyRuleHint: Rolling a 10 grants an extra success when throwing a Specialty.
SETTINGS.untrainedMalusHint: Malus to the Difficulty : First digit for Talents, second for Skills and last one for Knowledges. ('X' indicates an unfeasible throw)
SETTINGS.useHealthMalus: Health Malus to the Dice Pool.
SETTINGS.useHealthMalusHint: Automatically applies the health malus tothe Dice Pool (see : editable list of health maluses in context menu).
SETTINGS.useHealthMalusForMagicHint: Also applies the health malus to the dice pool when throwing magick effects.
